default: (a) a {@item shortsword|phb}, (b) any {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand}, (c) a {@item shortbow|phb} and 20 arrows or (d) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 bolts

classFeature.name: Genetic Heritage
entries: At 1st level you choose a genetic heritage, which determines the primogenitor that your gene seed originates from. There are several to choose from that grant you features at 1st, 4th, 8th, 13th, 15th, and 18th level; all of which are detailed at the end of the class description.

classFeature.name: Optional Features
entries: Some Genetic Heritages will present optional features such as Genetic Disparity and Genetic Flaws that refer to and modify base class features. Although it is intended that you use such features, it is your choice if you want to include these or not.

classFeature.name: Secondary Heart
entries: At 1st level you start your transformation from human to superhuman with the simplest and most self-sufficient of implants; allowing you to survive your other heart being damaged or destroyed as well as surviving in low oxygen environments. Not just a back-up however, this secondary heart boosts the blood flow around your body.

You gain advantage on Constitution saving throws; it also boosts your movement speed by 5 feet at 1st level, and by an additional 5 feet at 6th, 11th, 16th and 20th levels as shown in the Bonus Movement column of the class table.

classFeature.name: Conditioning
entries: At 2nd level, due to rigorous conditioning, through chemical treatment, indoctrination, and hypnotherapy alongside your implants, you gain bonuses to your ability scores each level from 2nd shown in the Ability Score Bonuses columns of the class table. These bonuses can allow your Strength and Constitution ability scores to go higher than 20, however they cannot go higher than 24, and your other ability scores cannot go higher than 20.

classFeature.name: Ossmodula
entries: At 2nd level you gain a small, complex, tubular organ, that secretes hormones which affect the ossification of the skeleton and encourages the forming of bone growths to absorb ceramic-based chemicals that are laced into your diet. This drastically alters the way your bones grow and develop. After this implant is first put in your bones will increase in size and strength, and your rib cage will fuse into a solid mass of bulletproof, interlocking plates.
You gain proficiency in Strength saving throws and you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

classFeature.name: Biscopea
entries: At 3rd level this small, circular organ is inserted into your chest cavity, releasing hormones that vastly increase muscle growth throughout your body. It also serves to form the hormonal basis for many of the later implants.
Your unarmed strikes do 1d4 + your Strength modifier in bludgeoning damage on a hit. This increases to 1d6 at 11th level and 1d8 at 18th level.

classFeature.name: Haemastamen
entries: At 4th level this organ is implanted into your main circulatory system, this tiny implant not only increases the haemoglobin content of the subject's blood, making it more efficient at carrying oxygen around the body and making the subject's blood a bright red, it also serves to monitor and control the previous two implants.

Your body is now a head or more taller than other men as your height and weight are increased by 12 inches and 195lbs respectively. You gain advantage on Intimidation rolls if you are taller or larger than the creature you are trying to intimidate.

classFeature.name: Training Regimen
entries: At 4th level your punishing training regimen has honed your combat skills and you gain proficiency in one {@filter martial melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon=sand} and one {@filter martial ranged weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;ranged weapon=sand} of your choice.
At 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
At 8th level you choose two more {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} to become proficient in and you gain proficiency in medium armour.

At 13th level yours skills broaden and you become proficient in all {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}. You also learn how to fight defensively and gain proficiency in shields.
At 15th level you gain proficiency in heavy armour.

classFeature.name: Genetic Heritage Feature
entries: At 4th level, you gain a feature granted by your Genetic Heritage.

classFeature.name: Larraman's Organ
entries: At 5th level you receive a liver-shaped organ about the size of a golf-ball, this implant is placed within the chest cavity and connected to the circulatory system. It generates and controls 'Larraman cells' which are released into the blood stream if you are wounded. They attach themselves to leucocytes in the blood and are carried to the site of the wound, where upon contact with air they form a near instant patch of scar tissue, sealing any wounds you may suffer.

On your turn, you can use your action to regain hit points equal to 1d12 + your Constitution modifier. This improves to 2d12 at 10th level, 3d12 at 15th level, and 4d12 at 20th level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

classFeature.name: Catalepsean Node
entries: At 6th level the node is implanted into the back of the brain, this pea-sized organ influences the circadian rhythms of sleep and the body's response to sleep deprivation. If deprived of sleep, the catalepsean node cuts in. The node allows you to sleep and remain awake at the same time by switching off areas of your brain sequentially. This process cannot replace sleep entirely, but increases the your survivability by allowing perception of your environment whilst you rest.

You need only rest for 4 hours during a long rest to gain the same benefit as if you had rested the full 8 hours and you can go for up to two weeks without sleeping. You may also ignore one level of {@condition exhaustion} between long rests.

classFeature.name: Preomnor
entries: At 7th level you receive the Preomnor; this is essentially a pre-stomach that can neutralise otherwise poisonous or indigestible foods. No actual digestion takes place in the preomnor, as it acts as a decontamination chamber placed before the natural stomach in the body's system and can be isolated from the rest of the digestive tract in order to contain particularly troublesome intake.
Spoiled, rotten and raw food causes you no ill effects when ingested and you gain advantage on saving throws against any poison you consume.

classFeature.name: Omophagea
entries: At 8th level you receive the Omophagea. This implant, also called "the Remembrancer", allows you to 'learn by eating'. It is situated in the spinal cord but is actually part of the brain. Four nerve bundles are implanted connecting the spine and the stomach wall; able to 'read' or absorb genetic material you consume, the omophagea transmits the gained information to your brain as a set of memories or experiences.
You gain advantage on Intelligence (History) checks to learn information known to a creature you have consumed the genetic material of within the last hour.

classFeature.name: Genetic Heritage Feature
entries: At 8th level, you gain a feature granted by your Genetic Heritage.

classFeature.name: Multi-lung
entries: At 9th level this additional lung is implanted and activates when you need to breathe in low-oxygen or poisoned atmospheres, and even water. Your natural lungs are closed off by a sphincter muscle associated with the multi-lung and the implanted organ takes over breathing operations. It has highly efficient toxin dispersal systems.
You gain advantage on saving throws against airborne effects or attacks that deal poison damage; additionally you are also able to breathe underwater.

classFeature.name: Occulobe
entries: At 10th level you receive the Occulobe. This implant sits at the base of the brain, and provides hormonal and genetic stimuli which enable your eyes to respond to optic-therapy. This in turn allows the Apothecaries to make adjustments to the growth patterns of the eye and the light-receptive retinal cells - the result being that you have far superior vision to normal humans, and can see in low-light conditions almost as well as in daylight.

You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You are able to discern colour and detail as if you were in bright light within 30 feet of you; outside of that you can't discern colour in darkness, only shades of grey.
If you already have darkvision, then the range of your darkvision increases by 60 feet.

classFeature.name: Lyman's Ear
entries: At 11th level this implant makes a you immune from dizziness or motion sickness but also allows you to consciously filter out and enhance certain sounds.

You gain advantage against being {@condition stunned} or {@condition deafened} and have advantage against effects, such as spells, that require you to hear them. You also gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on your hearing.

classFeature.name: Sus-an Membrane
entries: At 12th level you receive the Sus-an Membrane. Initially implanted above the brain, this membrane eventually merges with the recipient's entire brain. Ineffective without follow-up chemical therapy and training, but with sufficient training a Space Marine can use this implant to enter a state of suspended animation, consciously or as an automatic reaction to extreme trauma, keeping the Marine alive for years, even if he has suffered otherwise mortal wounds.

When you are reduced to 0 hitpoints and knocked unconscious you receive temporary hit points equal to a quarter of your level rounded down + your Constitution modifier. If you take damage whilst you are unconscious the total inflicted is taken from these temporary hit points. If you fail three death saving throws and still have the temporary hit points you don't die but begin to lose 2 temporary hit points a turn until you reach 0, at which point you die. The feature only activates once per long rest.

classFeature.name: Melanchromic Organ
entries: At 13th level this implant controls the amount of melanin in your skin. Exposure to high levels of sunlight will result in the your skin darkening to compensate. It also protects your from other forms of radiation and dependant on your genetic heritage it may instead cause your skin pigmentation to permanently become extremely pale or take on an unnatural granite or obsidian-like quality.
You gain the ability to change the level of pigment in your skin to better protect against harsh sunlight.

classFeature.name: Genetic Heritage Feature
entries: At 13th level, you gain a feature granted by your Genetic Heritage.

classFeature.name: Oolitic Kidney
entries: At 14th level you receive the Oolitic Kidney. In conjunction with the secondary heart this implant allows you to filter your blood very quickly, rendering you immune to most poisons. This action comes at a price, however, as this emergency detoxification usually renders you {@condition incapacitated} while your blood is circulated at high speed. The organ's everyday function is to monitor the entire circulatory system and allow other organs to function effectively.

You gain resistance to Poison damage and advantage against being {@condition poisoned}. If {@condition poisoned}, you may use your action to filter your blood removing the {@condition poisoned} effect but making you {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition prone} and unable to move until the end of your next turn.
Additionally as your body is further changed by the gene-seed your height is increased by 11 inches and your weight is increased by 195lbs as your body grows larger and your mass more dense.

classFeature.name: Neuroglottis
entries: At 15th level you receive the Neuroglottis. This enhances your sense of taste to such a high degree that you can identify many common chemicals by taste alone.

You can even track down a creature by taste alone. You gain advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks to identify substances by taste and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track creatures by taste.

classFeature.name: Genetic Heritage Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Genetic Heritage.

classFeature.name: Mucranoid
entries: At 16th level this implant allows you to sweat a substance that coats your skin and offers resistance to extreme heat and cold and can even provide some protection in a vacuum.

If you do not move on your turn you can use your action to sweat and coat your skin, granting you resistance against either cold or fire damage (your choice when using your action) that lasts for a 1 minute. Once you use this action you must complete a long rest before you can use it again.

classFeature.name: Betcher's Gland
entries: At 17th level you receive the Betcher's Gland which consists of two identical glands, implanted either into the lower lip, alongside the salivary glands or into the hard palette. The gland works in a similar way to the poison gland of venomous reptile by synthesizing and storing deadly poison, which you yourself are immune to due to the gland's presence. This allows a you to spit a blinding contact poison. The poison is also corrosive and can even burn away strong metals given sufficient time.

You may use your bonus action to spit acid at a target, make a ranged attack at a creature within 10 feet using your Constitution modifier. On a hit it deals {@dice 2d6} Poison damage and {@dice 2d4} Acid damage and the target must make a Constitution save with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency + your Constitution modifier or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. This feature has a number of uses equal to your Constitution modifier and you regain all expended uses of this feature once you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Progenoids
entries: At 18th level you gain the Progenoids. There are two of these glands, one situated in the neck and the other within the chest cavity. These glands are vitally important and represent the future of the your heritage, as the only way new implants can be produced is by reproducing it within the bodies of the astartes themselves.
When you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can do so with advantage. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Genetic Heritage Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Genetic Heritage.

classFeature.name: The Black Carapace
entries: At 19th level you receive The Black Carapace; the most distinctive implant of the astartes, it resembles a film of black ceramic material that is implanted directly beneath the skin of your torso in sheets. These sheets harden on the outside, increasing your durability even further.
Your AC bonus increases to +2.

classFeature.name: Apotheosis
entries: When you reach 20th level you achieve Apotheosis, the long process to become a full Astartes complete you're now at least two metres tall, extremely muscular and deadly with or without a weapon; something beyond the mortal you once were.
You gain a +1 to your proficiency bonus, making its total +7.
Your height is increased by 12 inches and your weight is increased by 195lbs. You also age twenty times slower than normal.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Lion
entries: The Sons of The Lion hail from a region of dense and dark forests brimming with dangerous and deadly beasts; the Sons of The Lion form Knightly Orders that hunt down and slay these vile beasts to protect their towns and villages from the slaughter wrought by the denizens of the forests.

subclassFeature.name: Knightly Hunters
entries: At 1st level you gain hooded robes designed to be worn over your armour in addition to your starting equipment. You also have significant training in tracking, hunting, and slaying a certain type of enemy. Choose a type of enemy: aberrations, beasts or monstrosities. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track your chosen enemies, on Intelligence checks to recall information about them and on attack rolls made against them. You also choose one additional enemy type, at 8th and 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Interrogator
entries: At 4th level you gain advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks and advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Watcher in the Dark
entries: Starting at 8th level when you make an opportunity attack with longswords or greatswords, you make it with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude."
–Aldous Huxley

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god."
–Aristotle

subclassFeature.name: The Unbroken Sword
entries: At 13th level you can parry one enemy melee attack as a reaction whilst holding a longsword or greatsword, granting a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency against the attack whilst you are holding the weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Knightly Swordsmanship
entries: At 15th level your skill with the sword grants you a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with longswords and greatswords.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I would rather betray all that is beneath the Heavens before being betrayed by it."
–Cao Cao Mengde

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "When you were building empires, I studied the blade. When you were having council meetings, I hunted the Great Beasts. While you wasted your days at the table, writing treatises on tactics, I cultivated inner strength."
–The Lion

subclassFeature.name: Precision with the Blade
entries: At 18th level your melee weapon attacks with greatswords and longswords score a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20 and you can re-roll damage die of 1 or 2 but must take the second roll.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Phoenician
entries: Perfectionists through and through, be it in martial warfare or the arts, the Sons of the Phoenician strive to be the best at what they lay their hands to, creating some of the finest duellists and artisans.

subclassFeature.name: Artistic Indulgence
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency in two artisan's tools from the following list: {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|PHB}, {@item Glassblower's Tools|PHB}, {@item Jeweler's Tools|PHB}, {@item Painter's Supplies|PHB}, {@item Potter's Tools|PHB}, {@item Woodcarver's Tools|PHB}, or any {@filter musical instrument|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=instrument}.
Additionally your perfectionist nature and bohemian interests make you more prone to addiction and more likely to indulge in hedonism.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 4th level you gain a fighting style from the following list.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Duelling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons or a shield, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Two-Weapons Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
At 13th level and again at 18th level you may choose an additional fighting style. You may not choose the same fighting style twice.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Pride
entries: At 8th level you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls when you're attacking a creature in melee that has a challenge rating (or level) equal to or higher than your level.
However you take a -2 penalty to attack rolls against creatures with a challenge rating (or level) lower than a quarter of your level. This bonus or penalty is cumulative with a fighting style.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I finally figured out the only reason to be alive is to enjoy it."
–Rita Mae Brown

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "He that loves pleasure must to pleasure fall"
–Christopher Marlowe, Doctor Faustus

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: At 13th level you gain an additional fighting style from the list. You may not choose the same fighting style twice.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Flaws
entries: At 13th level your appearance may change, roll a d20. On a roll of 15 or higher your eyes become naturally violet in hue.
Additionally on a roll of 20 you lose your Melanchromic Organ feature as the implant malfunctions, leaving your skin a pale white colour.

subclassFeature.name: Fast Reflexes
entries: At 15th level you've honed your reactions and gain a +5 bonus to your Initiative.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "There's a point where this needs to stop and we've clearly passed it, but let's keep going and see what happens."
–anonymous

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "There is such a thing as perfection and our purpose for living is to find that perfection and show it forth. Everything that limits us we have to put aside."
–The Phoenician

subclassFeature.name: The Maru Skara
entries: At 18th level your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Fighting Style
entries: At 18th level you gain an additional fighting style from the list. You may not choose the same fighting style twice.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Iron
entries: The Sons of The Iron are bonded by a mutual brotherhood forged by their own hatred and bitter paranoia. Masters of long range and siege warfare they are as cold and hard as their name implies; chanting 'The Unbreakable Litany' as they methodically cut down their foes without remorse.

subclassFeature.name: Siege Expert
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency with {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Mason's Tools|PHB}. You also gain advantage on Intelligence checks relating to offensive siege warfare.

subclassFeature.name: Vicious Weaponry
entries: Starting at 4th level when wielding a flail, a maul or a warhammer, you can prepare yourself to extend your swing to sweep over targets' shields as a bonus action on your turn. Until the end of this turn, your attack rolls with a {@item flail|PHB}, a {@item maul|PHB}, or a {@item warhammer|PHB} gain a +2 bonus against any target using a shield.

subclassFeature.name: Hammer of Iron
entries: Starting at 8th level whenever you have disadvantage on a melee attack roll you make with a {@item flail|PHB}, a {@item maul|PHB}, or a {@item warhammer|PHB}, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but if the higher of the two d20 rolls would have hit.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "No one becomes depraved all at once."
–Juvenal, Satires

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Tell them ruin has come to their world, death, despair and red war...
Tell them their hopes and pride have come to nothing.
Tell them their empty whispers fall upon deaf ears - their gods are dead, human logic has killed them.
Tell them the Angels of Death have come.
Tell them that nothing can save them now."
–The Iron

subclassFeature.name: Iron Within, Iron Without
entries: At 13th level you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.
Additionally at 15th level you gain the following benefits while you are wielding a shield:
If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
If you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Within, Iron Without
entries: Additionally at 15th level you gain the following benefits while you are wielding a shield:
If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
If you aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 15th level, roll a d20. On a roll higher than 13 you become prone to paranoia and suspicion and your Intelligence score bonus is increased by +2 but your Charisma score bonus does not go higher than +2.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "The Iron throws men at walls. If the enemy so much as thought a wall he would pelt it with our men as if there were no other way."
–The Praetorian

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "You don't know the things I dream. No one does, no one ever cared enough to find out."
–The Iron

subclassFeature.name: Artillery Volley
entries: At 18th level you do not have disadvantage when attacking a target beyond a ranged weapon's normal range. If you're attacking a target beyond a ranged weapon's normal range you can make a single additional ranged attack against the same target as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Khan
entries: The Sons of The Khan are often recruited from the nomad tribes that inhabit the steppes of their homeland. Their savage fury is tempered by a fierce sense of honour and justice, as they engage in lightning fast cavalry strikes to run down their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Skilled Rider
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency with the {@skill Animal Handling} skill and {@filter vehicles (land)|items|source=phb;dmg|miscellaneous=mundane|type=vehicle (land)}. You are able to move normally both on foot and on a mount through non-magical difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Starting at 4th level, your mastery as a rider becomes apparent. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you're not {@condition incapacitated}. Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

subclassFeature.name: Swift Action
entries: Starting at 8th level you gain the ability to dash as a bonus action whilst on foot.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Power and speed be hands and feet."
–Ralph Waldo Emerson

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Conquering the world on horseback is easy; it is dismounting and governing that is hard."
–attributed to Genghis Khan

subclassFeature.name: Mounted Superiority
entries: At 13th level you gain advantage on melee attack rolls with {@item scimitar|PHB|scimitars} and {@item glaive|PHB|glaives} against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount if you yourself are mounted.
Additionally for the purposes of riding mounts you only count as weighing 500 lb. even if your weight exceeds that.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Defender
entries: At 15th level you can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead. If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "This what I was made for, I will ride out."
–The Khan

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "There is nowhere left to hide, we know you now. We shall hunt you in every plane of reality. So look on me now, yaksha, and know your slayer."
–The Khan

subclassFeature.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: At 18th level, you can run down your foes, whether you're mounted or not. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a creature and hit it with a melee attack on your turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Wolf King
entries: The Sons of The Wolf King hail from the frozen wilds teeming with packs of winter wolves, they are outwardly savage and seem little better than the creatures from which they draw their name-sake. However behind this ruse lies a fierce cunning and loyalty few other Astartes could match.

subclassFeature.name: One of the Aett
entries: When you choose this genetic heritage at 1st level you learn how to speak, read and write {@language Giant|PHB} and {@language Winter Wolf|MM}, the latter having no written script.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Rite of Passage
entries: At 1st level you begin your right of passage, forgoing the Training Regime feature listed previously. You lose your Light Armour proficiency and instead gain proficiency with Heavy Armour.
At 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

At 8th level your combat skills have grown stronger and you gain proficiency with one {@filter martial melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon=sand} and one {@filter martial ranged weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;ranged weapon=sand} of your choice.
At 13th level you gain proficiency with shields and gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with the martial weapons you chose proficiency with at 8th level.
At 15th level you gain proficiency with all martial weapons; your +1 bonus to attack rolls only applies to the martial weapons you first chose proficiency with at 8th level.

subclassFeature.name: Canis Helix
entries: At 4th level you notice your canines starting to lengthen and your fingernails beginning to harden, becoming keen like knives. You now do slashing damage with your unarmed strikes if your head or hands are not covered by armour or clothing.

subclassFeature.name: Wolf-kin
entries: At 4th level you gain proficiency in {@skill Animal Handling} and {@skill Perception}, adding double your proficiency bonus to the latter if you are already proficient. You also gain advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks against {@creature wolf|MM|wolves}, including {@creature dire wolf|MM|dire wolves} at 13th level and {@creature winter wolf|MM|winter wolves} at 18th.

subclassFeature.name: Headstrong
entries: Starting at 8th level when you move at least 10 feet towards a creature and take the Attack action on your turn, you gain a +2 bonus to melee attack rolls made against that creature until the end of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I am the punishment of God...If you had not committed great sins, God would not have sent a punishment like me upon you."
–Genghis Khan

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "It never troubles the wolf how many the sheep may be."
–Virgil

subclassFeature.name: Environmental Adaptation
entries: At 13th level your enhanced body has adapted to the cold, making you noticeably very hirsute. You gain resistance to Cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Runes of Warding
entries: At 13th level you decorate your armour with runes and totems of warding, a custom from the tribes native to the The Wolf King's homeland. Once a day, you can gain advantage on a saving throw against a spell or halve the damage from a spell attack made against you.

subclassFeature.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Starting at 15th level you gain advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Beat your thoughts to the mould of your will."
–The Wolf King

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "You will be faster than they are, stronger, quicker to sense corruption and with full sanction to destroy it. You will be girded in the armour of the gods and carry blades of ruin. You will never age, never wither, never weary."
–The Wolf King

subclassFeature.name: Howl of Winter
entries: When you reach 18th level you feel now more than ever the beast lurking inside you. As a bonus action you may emit a blood curdling howl, dropping any weapons or shields you are holding as you unleash the wolf within.
For 1 minute you may only use your unarmed strikes when you take the attack action, but the number of attacks you make is doubled.
Additionally for the duration, you gain a bite attack that deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier in piercing damage; you can use this bite attack as a bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you may use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Praetorian
entries: The Sons of The Praetorian are masters in the art of fortress building, the work of their craft is nigh impregnable and has stood undaunted for thousands of years much like the Sons themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Fortress-Craft
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency with {@item Carpenter's Tools|PHB} and {@item Mason's Tools|PHB}. You also gain advantage on Intelligence checks relating to defensive siege warfare.

subclassFeature.name: Unfaltering Fire
entries: At 4th level you gain advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. Additionally if you're in three-quarters cover you can use your bonus action to make a single additional ranged attack if you took the attack action on your turn.
Starting at 13th level this also includes half cover.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Marksman
entries: At 8th level you gain advantage on ranged attacks whilst in at least three-quarters cover.
At 18th level this also includes half-cover.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit."
–Noël Coward

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Flaws
entries: When you reach 12th level roll a d20, on a 1 you lose the use of your Sus-an Membrane feature.
When you reach 17th level roll a d20 again, on a 1 you lose the use of your Betcher's Gland feature.

subclassFeature.name: Unfaltering Fire
entries: Starting at 13th level your Unfaltering Fire feature also includes half cover.

subclassFeature.name: Firing Drill
entries: Starting at 15th level if you move 0ft on your turn you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with crossbows (light, heavy, hand, etc) and you ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "If we are not ashamed to think it, we should not be ashamed to say it."
–Marcus Tullius Cicero

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Flaws
entries: When you reach 17th level roll a d20, on a 1 you lose the use of your Betcher's Gland feature.

subclassFeature.name: Phalanx
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your action to plant your shield in the ground to create a 5ft wide by 4ft tall area of half cover as long as your shield is big enough to provide that size of cover (at your DM's discretion). This cover lasts until the shield is either destroyed or uprooted as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Steady Marksman
entries: At 18th level your Steady Marksman feature also includes half-cover.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Night
entries: Drawn from the worst cutthroats and criminals in the land, the Sons of The Night are cruel and callous murderers who decorate their armour with the bones and flayed skin of their enemies, stalking the shadows like supernatural predators.

subclassFeature.name: Selfish Blood
entries: When you take this genetic heritage at 1st level you can use your bonus action to dash if you used your action to disengage.

subclassFeature.name: Night Terrors
entries: At 4th level you gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} and {@skill Intimidation} skills. If you are already proficient in one of these skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled for that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Throwing Daggers
entries: At 8th level if you have a {@item dagger|PHB} in your inventory you can use your bonus action to draw and throw the {@item dagger|PHB} at a creature within 10ft with advantage on the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Silent Movement
entries: At 8th level medium armour that you are proficient with does not impose disadvantage to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) rolls.
At 15th level this also includes heavy armour that you are proficient with.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "He who fights with monsters should be careful lest he thereby become a monster. And if thou gaze long into an abyss, the abyss will also gaze into thee."
–Friedrich Nietzsche

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "There is no such thing as paranoia. Your worst fears can come true at any moment."
–Hunter S. Thompson

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of The Night
entries: At 13th level the range for your darkvision is increased by 60 feet.

However you have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
Additionally roll a d20, on a 13 or higher your eyes become jet black.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 13th level your Dexterity score bonus is improved by +1, to an eventual total of +7 at 20th level; but your Strength score bonus does not go higher than +7.
Additionally roll a d20, on a roll of 13 or higher your natural skin tone becomes increasingly pale until it is deathly white.

subclassFeature.name: Cruel Counter
entries: Starting at 15th level when you take the Attack action and attack with only a {@item glaive|PHB}, {@item halberd|PHB}, or {@item quarterstaff|PHB}, you can use your bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary weapon. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice d6}, and the attack deals bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Know how I stayed alive this long? All these years? Fear. The spectacle of fearsome acts. Somebody steals from me: I cut off his hands. He offends me: I cut out his tongue. He rises against me: I cut off his head, stick it on a pike. Raise it high up so all in the streets can see. That's what preserves the order of things. Fear."
–Bill the Butcher, Gangs of New York

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "It is better by far to be an object of fear than of respect, for one is a truth of the soul and the other an illusion of the mind."
–The Codex Hydra

subclassFeature.name: A Talent for Murder
entries: At 18th level you gain +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls against a creature if the number of your allies who aren't {@condition incapacitated} within 5 feet of the creature is greater the number of the creature's allies who aren't {@condition incapacitated} within 5 feet of the creature.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Angel
entries: The Sons of The Angel are noble and fierce fighters that hide a dark and terrible secret. Whilst appearing as one of the more upstanding heritages they're cursed with an unending thirst for blood that gives rise to rumours amongst those who would dare speak ill about them.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Strikes
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you take the Attack action on your turn and have advantage on an attack roll against one of the targets, you can forgo the advantage for that roll to make an additional weapon attack against that target, as part of the same action. You can do so no more than once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: Starting at 4th level as a bonus action on your turn, you can give yourself advantage on weapon attack rolls until the end of the current turn.
You can use this feature three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Red Thirst
entries: At 8th level, after killing an enemy in melee make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC of 5, on a failed save you're filled with blood thirst and you must use your next action to consume the flesh and blood of the slain, gaining 1d6 hit points when doing so. The DC for the throw goes up to DC 10 after three days of not consuming blood.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "If you truly do hail from the realm that men once called hell, when you return there, tell your kindred it was The Angel who threw you back."
–The Angel, to a defeated fiend

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself."
–Joseph Campbell

subclassFeature.name: Without Relent, Without Remorse
entries: At 13th level, as a reaction when a hostile creature leaves your reach, you may forgo your attack of opportunity to follow the creature for up to half your movement speed and then make your attack if they're still in range to do so.
However you cannot voluntarily take cover or go {@condition prone} in combat.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Prowess
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain a +2 bonus to melee attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "My good blade carves the casques of men,
My tough lance thrusteth sure,
My strength is as the strength of ten,
Because my heart is pure."
–Sir Galahad, Tennyson

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "It is not the descent toward the shadow nor the rise toward the light that makes us superior. It is the endless struggle between the two that greatness of character lies. We are tested, and we do not break."
–The Angel

subclassFeature.name: Keen Edge
entries: Starting at 18th level, your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20 if you have advantage on the attack.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Gorgon
entries: The Sons of The Gorgon value strength above all else, resenting even their own enhanced flesh and preferring the cold certainty of steel; going so far as coat their own hands with plates of mithril to show their devotion.

subclassFeature.name: Metallurgy Master
entries: When you take this heritage at 1st level you gain proficiency {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB} and you gain advantage on Knowledge (Intelligence) checks relating to metallurgy and to identify types of metal.

subclassFeature.name: Manus Tenet Ferrum
entries: Starting at 4th level you take part in the Manus Tenet Ferrum, a ritual which coats your hands and forearms in segments of magic-infused mithril. You add your Strength modifier twice to your unarmed strike's damage rolls.
At 18th level this also applies to any melee weapons you chose proficiency with from your Training Regimen feature at 4th level and 8th level.

subclassFeature.name: Stand and Fight
entries: Starting at 8th level you cannot voluntarily take cover or go {@condition prone} in combat and cannot voluntarily take the disengage action.
Additionally you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking."
–William Butler Yeats

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "By turns our purity inspires and our impurity casts us down."
–Henry David Thoreau

subclassFeature.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: Starting at 13th level when you hit with an opportunity attack using a {@item warhammer|PHB}, {@item mace|PHB} or {@item maul|PHB} the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Inviolate Armour
entries: At 15th level whilst wearing heavy armour you can negate non-magical damage from ranged attacks. When hit by a ranged attack, roll 2d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack's damage. This reduction is done before any applicable resistances or vulnerabilities are taken into account. However you suffer a -1 penalty to your initiative value.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Steel isn't strong, boy. Flesh is stronger. What is steel compared to the hand that wields it?"
–Thulsa-Doom to Conan the Barbarian

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "With steel we are stronger, but without a soul we are nothing."
–Kardan Stronos

subclassFeature.name: Manus Tenet Ferrum
entries: At 18th level this also applies to any melee weapons you chose proficiency with from your Training Regimen feature at 4th level and 8th level.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 18th level your Strength and Constitution score bonuses increase by +1, to an eventual total of +9 each at 20th level, but your Dexterity score bonus does not go higher than +4.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Slaughterer
entries: The Sons of The Slaughterer are bloodthirsty and barbaric, bordering on the outright insane. Primal gladiators of raw violence that revel in bloodshed, they're eventually driven to madness by the Butcher's Nails boring into their brains. They make terrifying opponents that leave naught but rent and riven corpses in their wake.

subclassFeature.name: Gladitorial Lineage
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency in one {@filter martial melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon=sand} of your choice and you may take that weapon in place of the {@item shortsword|PHB} in your starting equipment.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodlust
entries: Starting at 4th level you may re-roll dice rolls of 1 on damage dice for melee weapon attacks.
At 13th level you may also re-roll dice rolls of 2 as well.

subclassFeature.name: Murderous Rage
entries: At 8th level magic-infused metal rods known as the Butcher's Nails are implanted into your brain. When you kill an enemy you must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the number of creatures you have reduced to 0 hit points since you last finished a long rest.

On a failed save you enter a Murderous Rage, gaining advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, 1d4 bonus damage to melee attacks which goes up to 2d4 at 15th level. You also gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. On your turn you must move as far as you can towards the nearest enemy creature in range, and use your attack action against it. If there are no hostile creatures within view then any creature (including friendly creatures) within view becomes your target. If you are unable to attack a target after using your full movement you must use your action to dash towards the target; if this enables you to reach your target you can make one melee attack at disadvantage as a bonus action. If you are unable to attack a target on your turn you take {@dice 1d8} psychic damage. Attacks against you have advantage.

Your murderous rage ends if: Your rage has lasted 1 minute and you have not attacked a creature on your previous turn, you are knocked {@condition unconscious} by any means or if you've not attacked any creatures during your last two turns. If any of these conditions are met at the end of one of your turns, your Murderous Rage ends and you take {@dice 2d8} psychic damage.
Once a Murderous Rage occurs you must finish a short or a long rest before it can occur again.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I was born in blood, raised in darkness and I shall die free!"
–The Slaughterer

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I-I am going to be a storm-a flame-
I need to fight whole armies alone;
I have ten hearts; I have a hundred arms;
I feel too strong to war with mortals-,
BRING ME GIANTS!"
–Edmond Rostand, Cyrano de Bergerac

subclassFeature.name: Violence Incarnate
entries: Starting at 13th level when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodlust
entries: At 13th level you may also re-roll dice rolls of 2 as well on damage dice for melee weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Monster
entries: Starting at 15th level when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you instead remain on 1 hit point and gain 1d12 + your Constitution modifier in temporary hit points, entering a Murderous Rage if you're not already in one. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "That's because you're free. The world can be beautiful, when you finally get to see it without chains."
–The Slaughterer

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Courage is fighting the kingdom which enslaves you, no matter that their armies outnumber yours by ten-thousand to one. You know nothing of courage! Honor is resisting a tyrant when all others suckle and grow fat on the hypocrisy he feeds them. You know nothing of honor!"
–The Slaughterer

subclassFeature.name: The Eightfold Path
entries: At 18th level when you take the attack action and make at least one melee attack, you may make two additional attacks with a bonus action.

Due to their continued effects on your brain the Butcher's Nails increase your aggression even further, your Murderous Rage is no longer limited to occuring once and the DC for the wisdom saving throw you take when killing an enemy is now 10 + the number of enemies you've reduced to 0 hit points since you last finished a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Regent
entries: The Sons of The Regent are empire builders in their entirety, priding themselves on the small dominion they carved themselves in the land. Trained in squad warfare they fight alongside one another with almost supernatural precision.

subclassFeature.name: Art of War
entries: When you choose this heritage at 1st level you gain proficiency in one {@filter artisan's tools|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=artisan's tools} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Starting at 4th level you can use your bonus action to use one of the Combat Tactics detailed below. You can do this twice and regain expended uses after you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: With me, as one!
entries: You may, after hitting a target with an attack, use your bonus action to choose up to 3 friendly creatures you can see to gain advantage on their attack rolls against the target hit by your attack until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Focus Fire!
entries: You gain advantage on attack rolls against a target that's already been hit by an ally's attack this round.

items.name: Rally to me brothers!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures you can see, they all gain temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

items.name: Hold the line!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures you can see which may include yourself. If a hostile creature comes within 5 feet of one of these creatures, said creature may use their reaction to make a single melee attack against the creature.
You gain two additional uses of this feature at 10th level and another two uses at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: And They Shall Know No Fear
entries: At 8th level you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws that would cause you to become {@condition frightened} or flee from a hostile creature.
At 13th level this includes Charisma saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Leadership is not magnetic personality, that can just as well be a glib tongue. It is not "making friends and influencing people", that is flattery. Leadership is lifting a person's vision to higher sights, the raising of person's performance to a higher standard, the building of a personality beyond its normal limitations."
–Peter F. Drucker

subclassFeature.name: Additional Combat Tactics
entries: At 10th level you gain two additional uses of your Combat Tactics feature.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Julius Caesar learned that Alexander, having completed nearly all his conquests by the time he was thirty-two years old, was at an utter loss to know what he should do during the rest of his life, whereat Augustus expressed his surprise that Alexander did not regard it as a greater task to set in order the empire which he had won than to win it."
–Plutarch

subclassFeature.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: At 13th level you gain advantage on Knowledge ({@skill Arcana}) and Knowledge ({@skill Nature}) checks to identify the weaknesses of an enemy.

subclassFeature.name: And They Shall Know No Fear
entries: At 13th level your And They Shall Know No Fear feature includes Charisma saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Diverse Training
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to 2 skills of your choice from the list under class features that you are not proficient with.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Never wish for danger. Danger needs no help. There is no such thing as fate that can be tempted, but morale is never improved by an active lust for war."
–The Regent

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "What does not kill me... is not trying hard enough."
–The Regent

subclassFeature.name: Coup De Grâce
entries: At 18th level you can make a Coup De Grâce attack. The target of this attack requires a head or similar vital organ. Using your action make a single attack roll with a weapon. On a hit, the target makes a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 10 + the difference between your attack roll and the target's AC. If they fail the save they are dealt a mortal blow, such as a decaptiation, are reduced to 0 hitpoints and die outright. If they succeed they take five times the damage rolled for the attack you used. You can use this feature once, and regain the use of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Combat Tactics
entries: At 18th level you gain two additional uses of your Combat Tactics feature.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Reaper
entries: The Sons of The Reaper are macabre masters of poison and decay. Revelling in their resistance to toxins even other astartes cannot handle and delighting in the rot and ruin they bring to others, their unwavering advance cutting down their quarry like the very scythes they wield.

subclassFeature.name: Toxic Obsession
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|PHB} and you can apply poison to a weapon or 10 pieces of ammunition as a bonus action on your turn. The poison applied also retains its potency for as long as the item remains in your possession.

subclassFeature.name: Manreaper
entries: At 4th level you gain proficiency with Manreapers, a large and vicious scythe weapon. You can spend 1 hour and 10gp to craft a {@item war pick|PHB} into a Manreaper. Resembling a large scythe it now deals slashing damage instead of piercing and it gains the versatile (1d10) property.
If you are wielding a manreaper with two hands you may make your attack at disadvantage to target up to three creatures that are within 5 feet of you and adjacent to each other.

subclassFeature.name: Implacable Advance
entries: At 8th level your movement speed can never be decreased below 5 feet. Effects that would cause you to be unable to move, like the {@condition paralyzed} condition, will still stop you from moving.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "We are all tyrants. Do not fool yourself. We were bred for nothing else."
–The Reaper

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Now, I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds."
–Robert Oppenheimer, quoting the Hindu religious text, the Bhagavad Gita

subclassFeature.name: Portents of Rot
entries: At 13th level you gain immunity to poison damage and you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} and {@condition frightened} conditions.
At 15th level you also gain resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Portents of Rot
entries: At 15th level you also gain resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "I am not like you. I do not wallow in this corruption. I use it. I control it. I set bounds on it."
–The Reaper

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 17th level your Constitution score bonus increases by +1 to a total of +9, but your Charisma score bonus does not go higher than +3.

subclassFeature.name: Plaguebringer
entries: At 18th level you can use your bonus action to enchant your weapon. For one minute your attacks deal extra necrotic damage equal to half the damage rolled (rounded down).

Additionally a creature hit by your attacks while this feature is active must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the start its turn or become {@condition poisoned} and take {@dice 2d8} poison damage; the save has a DC of 8 + your Constitution modifier. On a successful save the creature is not {@condition poisoned} and takes half of the poison damage.
You can regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Crimson King
entries: The Sons of The Crimson King are renown wizards, lore-masters of the arcane arts and practitioners of dangerous magicks. They possess an arrogance and hubris in their arcane abilities that may well be their undoing.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Academic
entries: At 1st level you gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana} & {@skill History} skills. If you are already proficient in one of these skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled for that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Guiding Tutelary
entries: At 4th level you gain a tutelary, a celestial, fey or fiend familiar that exists on the astral plane who is controlled by the Dungeon Master. Once a day during a short rest you can meditate and ask it three questions; the Dungeon Master has discretion if the answers are true or false, obvious or cryptic and whether or not your tutelary would actually know the answers you seek.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Scrolls
entries: At 8th level you gain the ability to create spell scrolls. You may possess a number of them equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1); if you create an additional scroll above your limit, you choose which of the pre-existing scrolls is destroyed.

When you find a wizard spell, you can copy it to a spell scroll if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it. For each level of the spell, the process takes 1 hour and costs 25 gp. The cost represents material components you expend making the scroll and the fine inks you need to record the spell itself.

When you copy a spell from an existing spell scroll, you must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll being copied from is destroyed.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge, the more grief."
–Ecclesiastes 1:18

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "The minds of gods are not for mortals to know or to judge."
–The Crimson King

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Awakening
entries: At 13th level you begin to unlock your true magical potential, learning to reach into the warp and weave of the unseen world to draw forth power.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. You learn additional wizard cantrips of your choice at 16th level and 19th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Sons of The Crimson King Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest. For example, when you are 17th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell thunderwave, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 13th level, you know one 1st-level spell of your choice from the wizard spell list. You learn one additional spell from the wizard spell list each time you gain a level.

A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level and {@b must} come from the same school of magic as your other spells of 1st level and higher. When you reach 16th level, for example, you learn a new wizard spell which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the wizard spells you know and replace it with another spell from the wizard spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots and the same school of magic as your other spells of 1st level and higher.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your wizard spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Finally when you cast a spell you risk the chance that your magic becomes unstable and uncontrollable, damaging you and others around you. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, roll an Intelligence save with a DC equal to 5 + the spell slot level being used.

On a failed save the spell still takes place but you cause a surge in wild magic, after resolving the spell's effects roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to determine the effects. In addition you take a number of {@dice d10} equal to the spell's level in psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Weaponry
entries: At 15th level you can use a melee weapon you are holding as a spellcasting focus.

Additionally you can use your bonus action when holding a melee weapon to imbue it with magical power by expending a spell slot. The next hit with that melee weapon deals an additional {@dice 1d8} psychic damage per spell slot level used. The magical power in the weapon fades after 1 minute if not used or as soon as you are no longer holding the melee weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 15th level your Intelligence score bonus increases by +2 but your Constitution score bonus cannot raise higher than +6 and your Constitution score cap is lowered to 22.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans."
–Woody Allen

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "If I am guilty of anything, it is the simple pursuit of knowledge."
–The Crimson King

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Discipline
entries: At 18th level you gain a bonus depending on what school of magic you've chosen for your spells.

entries.name: Abjuration
entries: You can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a long rest. The ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.

While the ward has 0 hit points, it can't absorb damage, but its magic remains. Whenever you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell.
Once you create the ward, you can't create it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Conjuration
entries: While you are concentrating on a conjuration spell, your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

entries.name: Divination
entries: Glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness. When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

entries.name: Enchantment
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to divert the attack, provided that another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a Wisdom saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including you or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, you can't use this feature on the attacker again until you finish a long rest.
You must choose to use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Evocation
entries: You can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your evocation spells. When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Illusion
entries: You can create an illusory duplicate of yourself as an instant, almost instinctual reaction to danger. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to interpose the illusory duplicate between the attacker and yourself. The attack automatically misses you, then the illusion dissipates.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Necromancy
entries: You gain the ability to reap life energy from creatures you kill with your spells. Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy. You don't gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.

entries.name: Transmutation
entries: You add the {@spell polymorph} spell to your spellbook, if it is not there already. You can cast {@spell polymorph} without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can target only yourself and transform into a beast whose challenge rating is 1 or lower.
Once you cast {@spell polymorph} in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest, though you can still cast it normally using an available spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Lupercal
entries: The Sons of The Lupercal are considered the first and foremost amongst their many kin. They are a formidable force that often form the tip of the spear for a attacking army, poised to drive deep into the enemy's throat and cut off their head in a swift and decisive move.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptable
entries: When you take this genetic heritage at 1st level you gain two extra skill proficiencies from the list of skills presented under class features, or you may choose one of your skill proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.

subclassFeature.name: Pile In!
entries: At 4th level you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with melee weapons against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Better to reign in Hell than to serve in Heaven."
–Satan, in John Milton's Paradise Lost.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Angels are bright still, though the brightest fell."
–William Shakespeare

subclassFeature.name: Merciless Fighter
entries: At 8th level you can use your bonus action to make a single unarmed strike.

Additionally at the end of a creature within your reach's turn, you can use your reaction to make a single unarmed strike against that creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

subclassFeature.name: Close Combat
entries: At 13th level being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Additionally when you use the Attack action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed ranged weapon you are holding.

subclassFeature.name: Tip of the Spear
entries: Starting at 15th level you gain advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally you have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in the combat yet.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "When you have come to the edge of all that you know and are about to drop off into the darkness of the unknown, faith is knowing that one of two things will happen, that there will be something solid to stand on or you'll be taught to fly."
–The Lupercal

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Tell a man he has a new master and he will shrug.
Tell a man his new master wants a fifth of his income and he will go find his pitchfork."
–attributed to The Lupercal

subclassFeature.name: Bone Breaker
entries: Starting at 18th level when you score a critical hit with a melee attack you may attempt to cripple your foe. The creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier or be {@condition incapacitated}, have their movement speed reduced to 5 ft. and be knocked {@condition prone}. This effect remains until they are healed by a spell such as {@spell greater restoration}.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Word
entries: The Sons of The Word are fanatics and zealots, contrary to the other Sons who are largely secular the Sons of the Word embrace the polar extremes of faith with fervour, channelling their devotion into every action.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Devotion
entries: When choosing this heritage at 1st level you gain a holy symbol of either a lawful good deity or a chaotic evil deity (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Demagogue
entries: At 4th level you gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Religion} skills. If you are already proficient in one of these skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled for that skill.
Additionally you gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Banishment
entries: At 8th level when you successfully hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand} that deals bludgeoning damage or a {@item morningstar|PHB}, you can try to push the creature back. The creature makes a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier, on a failed save the creature is pushed 15 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 1). You regain any expended uses of this feature once you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 10th level, again at 14th level and at 18th level your Charisma score bonus increases by +1, to a total of +7. However your Strength and Constitution score bonuses do not raise higher than +7, with both scores unable to go higher than 23, and your Wisdom score bonus does not go higher than +5.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "From fanaticism to barbarism is only one step."
–Denis Diderot

subclassFeature.name: Zealous Crusader
entries: At 13th level you gain a number of zeal dice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), which are {@dice d4}s. You can roll a die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw you make.

Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against you, you can use your reaction to roll the Zeal die and add the number rolled to your AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses.
A zeal die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended zeal dice when you finish a long rest. At 18th level your Zeal dice are now {@dice d6}s.

subclassFeature.name: Undaunted
entries: At 15th level your tenacity and fervent faith spreads to others, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be {@condition frightened} while you are conscious.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "The difference between gods and daemons largely depends upon where one is standing at the time."
–Argel Tal

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Faith is the soul of any army; be it vested in primitive religion or enlightened truth.
It makes even the least soldier mighty, the craven is remade worthy and through its balm any hardship may be endured.
Faith ennobles all of the works the soldier undertakes be they so base or vile, and imports to them the golden spark of transcendant purpose."
–The Bearer of The Word

subclassFeature.name: The Power of Faith
entries: At 18th level you can use your action to pray to your deity for help. On your turn roll a {@dice d20} and add your Charisma modifier against a DC equal to your Charisma score.

On a success for 1 minute you add your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) to either: your AC and saving throws if the deity you chose is lawful good or your attack and damage rolls if the deity you chose is chaotic evil.
You need to finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Drake
entries: The Sons of The Drake are master craftsmen who claim their lineage descends from the dragons themselves. They focus on who they can save before what they can fight and are generally held in high regard for their consideration towards common-folk during conflicts.

subclassFeature.name: Prodigy of the Forge
entries: When you choose this genetic heritage at 1st level you gain proficiency in {@item Smith's Tools|PHB} and {@item Tinker's Tools|PHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Bloodline
entries: At 4th level you can speak, read and write {@language Draconic|PHB}, you gain resistance to Fire damage and weapons that cause Fire damage do twice as much Fire damage when wielded by you.
Additionally you are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition but have a -2 penalty to initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Hammer and Anvil
entries: At 8th level if you are attacking an enemy with a {@item warhammer|PHB} or {@item maul|PHB} when they are flanked by a wall or one of your allies with a shield the weapon damage you roll is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Flaws
entries: At 10th level your eyes begin glowing red due to a strange "ember-like" bioluminescence. Additionally at 13th level you skin begins to permenantly darken and adopts an unnatural granite-like or obsidian quality.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "Even the softest and sweetest heart was made by design for extreme battle."
–Bryant McGill

subclassFeature.name: Helping Hand
entries: At 13th level if you use the Help action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding a {@item warhammer|PHB} or {@item maul|PHB}, you knock the target's defence aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the ally gains a +2 bonus to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Forgemaster
entries: Starting at 15th level your knowledge with the forge and the arts of smithing allow you to upgrade your weapons and armor to be more effective.

For each level you want to upgrade the item the process takes 3 hours and costs five times the item's value in gold. The cost represents the materials required to improve the item; for each level of upgrade a weapon gains a +1 to its attack and damage rolls or a piece of armour gains +1 to its AC.
The maximum number of levels you can upgrade a item is 2; at 18th level the maximum increases to 3.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "The flesh is weak, but deeds endure."
–The Drake, to the Gorgon

subclassFeature.name: Optional Feature: Genetic Disparity
entries: At 17th level your Strength and Constitution score bonuses increase by +1 to a total of +9 each, but your Wisdom score bonus does not go higher than +4.

subclassFeature.name: The Unbound Flame
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your bonus action to ignite a melee weapon you are holding, once ignited it deals an extra {@dice 2d6} fire damage for 1 minute and is considered a magic weapon.

Creatures hit by your weapon while this feature is active must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Constitution modifier at the start of their next turn or take an additional {@dice 2d4} fire damage.
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sons of the Raven
entries: The Sons of The Raven are dark mannered and brooding, their sombre nature belying their true power. Masters of fast, harrowing attacks that are over as swiftly as they begin, leaving only death behind.

subclassFeature.name: Hit and Run
entries: When you chose this heritage at 1st level you have learnt how to use quick retreats between your attacks to avoid danger. You may disengage as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Silence
entries: At 4th level you gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill and armour no longer imposes disadvantage to {@skill Stealth} checks. If you are already proficient in {@skill Stealth}, your proficiency bonus is doubled for that skill.

subclassFeature.name: Death By A Thousand Cuts
entries: Starting at 8th level while you are wielding a melee weapon with the light property in each hand you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with those weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
entries: "When you're on your own, behind enemy lines, no artillery, no air strikes, no hope of an evac, you don't fight dirty. You do things that make dirty look good."
–The Punisher

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Quote
